Description: Fragment of neck and handle of Rhodian pottery transport amphora; light beige with limestone inclusions. Rectangular stamp.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Redpath Museum, Montreal. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Trimmed. Name Ermias. No other stamp of Ermias has a lunate epsilon; is the sign here an area of damage? The top line of a regular epsilon seems visible.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.1219)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Redpath Museum, Montreal
